New Tools, New Site
16 Aug 2013

Well, I've gone and redesigned and rebuilt this website!

I was wanting to optimise the site so that potential clients would find it easier to contact me and be better pursuaded that I will add value to their project. So I added a section about my Experience with Ruby and Rails, and some great Testimonials from recent clients.

I took the opportunity to build the site using Jekyll, a tool I hadn't had the opportunity to play with. I've found Jekyll to be ideal for a simple site like this, with a handful of pages and a basic Blog feature, and I can host the site free with Github Pages! I've also chosen to use Markdown for these Blog posts so they would be easier and quicker to write.

I wanted to have a go with a different front-end framework havinf used Twitter's Bootstrap and Zurb's Foundation before. So I went with Gumby which I've enjoyed using. I liked the flat design elements and of course it is responsive so the site will look good on small and large screens.

I also recently dabbled with Sinatra on a simple one page site. I had tried to use Sinatra a few years ago with the OpenCharities site, but for whatever reason it wouldn't work properly locally and the frustration made me abandon my efforts, so I'm glad I've started to understand it better.
